projects.title: Oncology Care Hub
projects.description: I was a foundational engineer for a greenfield chemotherapy prep workflow tool. Leading the frontend development, I chose and implemented frontend stack: React, Apollo client, and semantic UI with a custom theme. I then iterated with product on a clean display of data. I coded across the stack, leveraging Node.Js and Apollo server.

projects.title: InSight Care
projects.description: I developed interactive data visualizations using D3 and React as part of a pilot program which reduced patient ER visits. Check out the HBR article about the program.

projects.title: Darwin Digital Platform
projects.description: I was a frontend engineer on a small agile team that worked to improve the chart review experience for clinicians and researchers.

projects.title: DICED
projects.description: See emdata.janelia.org. I redesigned much of an existing React app for the Janelia FlyEM team. This single page app queries a backend api called DICED to dynamically load EM image data. The code is available here.

projects.title: FlyEM Neuroglancer
projects.description: I added several customizations to a fork of the popular open source neuroimaging viewer Neuroglancer for the Janelia FlyEM team. For this project, I worked with vanilla WebGL and TypeScript.

projects.title: Django Projects
projects.description: I have worked on three large Django applications and a collection of small admin apps. They are hosted on an internal network and closed-source. One of these project handled ordering stocks from an internal store. The other two were geared towards employee time tracking and billing. All were built with MySQL, Django, and jquery.

projects.title: ADHD/ASD Study Database
projects.description: I led a small team in the Fair Neuroimaging lab, building a Neo4j database for monitoring and visualizing study data. We built an object-oriented Python framework for importing data from many different sources into this database.

projects.title: HCP Exacloud
projects.description: I built a meta-pipeline for the Fair Neuroimaging lab launch and monitor the stages of the Human Connectome Pipeline on the Exacloud cluster, which previously needed a fair amount of human monitoring. My framework included built-in validation and notifications.

projects.title: Rubicon Atlas
projects.description: I worked for an edtech company developing a large application called Atlas, which was built on PHP, javascript, and MSSQL. Later, I worked on a smaller app for this company using AngularJS. This work was closed-source.
